agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Transportation TIME & DATE: 2:00 PM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, April 17, 2019 PLACE: E2.030 CHAIR: Rep. Terry Canales *Public testimony may be limited to two (2) minutes.* If submitting written documentation, please provide 15 copies (with your name on each) to the committee clerk before or during the hearing. If you intend to testify, please register using the electronic witness affirmation form, which will be available at any registration kiosk located throughout the Capitol Extension. Witness registration will open approximately two (2) hours prior to the start of the hearing and must be completed prior to testifying. HB 148 White Relating to the issuance of specialty license plates to honor Polish Americans in Texas. HB 487 Deshotel Relating to the issuance of specialty license plates for justices of the peace. HB 585 Geren Relating to the issuance of F-35 fighter jet specialty license plates. HB 633 Buckley | et al. Relating to the allocation of money associated with delays of transportation projects. HB 737 Cortez Relating to the issuance of specialty license plates for classroom teachers and retired classroom teachers; imposing a fee. HB 806 King, Ken | et al. Relating to the issuance of specialty license plates for justices of the peace. HB 1130 Hinojosa Relating to the issuance of Register to Vote specialty license plates. HB 1226 Lang | et al. Relating to highway maintenance vehicles. HB 1493 Krause Relating to weight limitations for over-the-road buses. HB 1541 Paddie Relating to the continuation and functions of the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles and to the operations of certain other entities performing functions associated with the department. HB 1644 Martinez Relating to Texas Department of Transportation and regional mobility authority comprehensive development agreements. HB 1928 Herrero Relating to the administration, powers, and duties of certain navigation districts. HB 2290 Buckley Relating to the placement of a slow-moving-vehicle emblem. HB 2549 Oliverson Relating to the authority of a county to provide tolling services for another toll project entity. HB 2578 Thompson, Ed Relating to toll collection and enforcement by private participants in comprehensive development agreements with the Texas Department of Transportation. HB 2620 Martinez Relating to the movement of oversize or overweight vehicles, including the enforcement of motor vehicle size and weight limitations; creating a criminal offense. HB 2705 Capriglione | et al. Relating to the use of job order contracts method by certain joint airport boards. HB 2752 Martinez Relating to job order contracting. HB 2863 Landgraf Relating to the applicability of competitive bidding requirements to expenditures for certain municipal utility facility relocations. HB 3161 Bailes | et al. Relating to the operation of a vehicle transporting equipment used to load timber. HB 3163 Springer Relating to parking for persons with disabilities. HB 3394 Johnson, Jarvis Relating to the issuance of sickle cell disease awareness specialty license plates. HB 3460 Thompson, Ed Relating to the route designation for the issuance of a permit for the movement of oversize and overweight vehicles in certain counties. HB 3469 Wilson Relating to fees charged for the operation of certain commercial motor vehicles on public highways; authorizing a fee. HB 3473 Perez Relating to the fee for a permit authorizing the movement of certain vehicles transporting an intermodal shipping container. HB 3510 VanDeaver Relating to the intermodal shipping container permit in north Texas. HB 3558 Farrar Relating to capturing images of the illegal passing of a stationary tow truck. HB 3760 Guillen Relating to the disposition of surplus vehicles by a governmental agency. HB 3850 Deshotel Relating to the funding of certain ship channel improvements. HB 3871 Krause Relating to the process for establishing speed limits on roads near certain schools. HB 3935 Bell, Cecil Relating to the certification of constables and deputy constables to enforce commercial motor vehicle safety standards. HB 3953 Murr Relating to motor vehicle operation and accidents. HB 4070 Oliverson Relating to the prosecution of the criminal offense of passing a school bus; increasing a criminal penalty. HB 4140 Murr Relating to license plate flippers. HB 4280 Morrison Relating to funding for counties for transportation infrastructure projects located in areas of the state affected by increased oil and gas production. HB 4436 Canales | et al. Relating to the board of pilot commissioners for Harris County ports. HB 4445 Canales | et al. Relating to the safe and efficient provision of pilot services by the Board of Pilot Commissioners for Harris County Ports. HB 4475 Ortega Relating to the ability of a governmental entity to contract for the development and operation of a transportation project. HB 4666 Deshotel Relating to the modernization of the law governing the Port of Beaumont Navigation District of Jefferson County, Texas. HB 4695 Deshotel Relating to the administration of the Port of Port Arthur Navigation District of Jefferson County, including the authority to impose taxes. HB 4727 Bonnen, Greg Relating to the designation of the portion of State Highway 35 in Matagorda County as the D. R. "Tom" Uher Memorial Highway. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills added after last posting: HB 4727 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
